channel.title: Posts on Backlog Reviews
channel.description: Recent content in Posts on Backlog Reviews

item.title: Chasm
item.description: This title is a retro-styled Metroidvania that aims to blend procedural generation with classic side-scrolling exploration.

item.title: T.R.A.G.: Mission of Mercy
item.description: A relatively obscure action-adventure game that attempted to combine tactical gameplay with a hostage-rescue narrative.

item.title: BPM Bullets Per Minute
item.description: This title is an energetic and highly distinctive fusion of rhythm game mechanics with FPS action.

item.title: Kirby Super Star
item.description: This title is one of the standout titles of the Kirby franchise and a highlight of the SNES’s library.

item.title: Guacamelee Super Turbo Championship Edition
item.description: A stylish, high-energy Metroidvania that blends colorful worldbuilding, tight combat, and clever platforming.

item.title: Super Mario Advance
item.description: One of the GBA’s launch titles, and it served as both a nostalgia trip and a technical showcase for Nintendo’s new handheld.

item.title: Strife Veteran Edition
item.description: A modern re-release of the 1996 hybrid FPS/RPG, it combines first-person action with light RPG mechanics.

item.title: Flashback The Quest for Identity
item.description: A game that bridged the gap between traditional 2D action and the emerging world of story-driven, film-like experiences.

item.title: Mega Man Zero 4
item.description: This marks the grand finale of the series, a refined and emotionally resonant experiences on the GBA.

item.title: Hollow Knight Silksong
item.description: The long-awaited sequel to one of the most beloved indie games of all time, Hollow Knight.

item.title: Blood Fresh Supply
item.description: A remaster of the 1997 title, by Nightdive Studios, it updates the original game with modern features like higher resolutions.

item.title: Dust An Elysian Tail
item.description: This title is a visually stunning 2D action-RPG with strong Metroidvania influences.

item.title: Gex Enter the Gecko
item.description: A 3D platformer that captures the essence of late-’90s gaming, a mix of quirky humor, pop culture parody.

item.title: MediEvil II
item.description: A delightful and whimsical action-adventure that successfully expands upon the foundation laid by its predecessor.

item.title: Onimusha 2 Samurai's Destiny
item.description: A remarkable sequel that successfully expands on the foundation laid by the original entry.

item.title: SOMA
item.description: A deeply atmospheric psychological horror experience that trades traditional scares for profound existential dread.

item.title: Castlevania Dracula X
item.description: An action-platformer by Konami, serving as a loose remake of the PC Engine classic Rondo of Blood.

item.title: Crysis
item.description: First entry to the Crysis franchise, a FPS that became instantly famous for its groundbreaking graphics and ambitious design.

item.title: Darksiders Genesis
item.description: A bold step for the long-running Darksiders franchise, shifting away from the traditional third-person formula.

item.title: Demon's Crest
item.description: A dark fantasy action-platformer, being the 3rd entry in the Gargoyle’s Quest series, a spin-off from Ghosts ’n Goblins.

item.title: Devil May Cry
item.description: A widely regarded as a seminal action game that helped define the Hack’N Slash genre.

item.title: Lara Croft and the Guardian of Light
item.description: This title marks a bold and refreshing detour from the traditional Tomb Raider formula.

item.title: Shadow Warrior
item.description: A modern reimagining of the 1997 cult classic, fusing nostalgic ‘90s shooter energy with slick, modern gameplay and visuals.

item.title: Super Castlevania IV
item.description: This is one of the finest examples of how a series can successfully transition into a new generation of hardware.

item.title: Syphon Filter 2
item.description: This sequel delivers a more polished and ambitious experience that cements its place among the PlayStation’s best titles.

item.title: Axiom Verge
item.description: An outstanding indie metroidvania that manages to feel both nostalgic and refreshingly original.

item.title: Legacy of Kain Defiance
item.description: This title stands as the climactic finale of one of gaming’s most intricate and ambitious storylines.

item.title: Max Payne 2 The Fall of Max Payne
item.description: A near-perfect example of how to build a sequel that respects its predecessor while deepening every aspect of its world.

item.title: Prince of Persia The Two Thrones
item.description: This title brings the Sands of Time trilogy to a strong and satisfying close.

item.title: Turok Dinosaur Hunter
item.description: A landmark release for the N64 and one of the first console FPSs to show that the genre could thrive outside of PC.

item.title: God of War Ghost of Sparta
item.description: This title serves as an interquel between the original God of War and its sequel.

item.title: Ocean's Heart
item.description: This title is a love letter to the classic top-down action-adventure of the 16-bit era.

item.title: Silent Hill 3
item.description: This is one of the most mature and psychologically unsettling entries in the survival horror genre.

item.title: Sinner Sacrifice for Redemption
item.description: This title is an action game, often described as a ‘Souls-like boss rush.’

item.title: Xenogears
item.description: This title is one of the most ambitious and memorable RPGs of the late 1990s.

item.title: Amnesia A Machine for Pigs
item.description: This sequel shifts from the mechanics-heavy survival horror, into a more narrative-driven, atmospheric experience.

item.title: Elderborn
item.description: A first-person melee action game, it combines a heavy-metal aesthetic with “souls-like” combat.

item.title: Lost Planet Extreme Condition
item.description: Set on the frozen planet E.D.N. III, where humanity battles both the harsh climate and creatures known as the Akrid.

item.title: Mega Man Zero 3
item.description: This title entry stands as one of the most refined and polished entries in the entire Mega Man franchise.

item.title: Tenchu Fatal Shadows
item.description: A stealth-action game that continues the dark, atmospheric tradition of the Tenchu series, set in feudal Japan.

item.title: Gauntlet
item.description: A modern reimagining of the beloved 1985 arcade classic, it preserves the chaotic, cooperative dungeon-crawling spirit.

item.title: Haunting Ground
item.description: A psychological survival horror game that stands out for its haunting atmosphere and unique companion mechanics.

item.title: Lara Croft Tomb Raider Anniversary
item.description: This title is a respectful and skillful remake of the original 1996 Tomb Raider.

item.title: Metal Warriors
item.description: This title is a standout example of how far developers could push the SNES near the end of its lifespan.

item.title: Goof Troop
item.description: This game blends lighthearted Disney charm with surprisingly clever gameplay design.

item.title: Kaze and the Wild Masks
item.description: A lovingly crafted 2D platformer that channels the energy and spirit of the 1990s with remarkable authenticity.

item.title: Kirby & The Amazing Mirror
item.description: This title experiments with non-linear exploration, setting it apart from previous Kirby titles.

item.title: Mafia II
item.description: A game with richly detailed world inspired by post-war America from the 1940s to the 1950s.

item.title: Maximo Ghosts to Glory
item.description: This title is an action-platformer that serves as a spiritual successor to Ghosts ’n Goblins.

item.title: Thief
item.description: This title is a bold attempt to revive the beloved stealth franchise for a modern audience.

item.title: Black Mesa
item.description: An extraordinary reimagining of Valve’s 1998 classic Half-Life, brought to life by the dedicated team at Crowbar Collective.

item.title: Castlevania Order of Ecclesia
item.description: This title is one of the most refined and challenging entries in the series’ handheld era.

item.title: New Super Mario Bros U
item.description: This title takes the classic 2D Mario platforming formula and gives it a fresh coat of HD polish.

item.title: Resident Evil Outbreak
item.description: A bold attempt to bring the classic Resident Evil survival horror formula into the world of online multiplayer.

item.title: Tomb Raider Underworld
item.description: This title marks the conclusion of the first trilogy with Lara Croft, following Legend and Anniversary.

item.title: Below
item.description: A hauntingly atmospheric top-down adventure that drops you onto a mysterious island to explore its depths.

item.title: Doom 3 BFG Edition
item.description: This title is a remastered and expanded collection that compiles all Doom 3 extra contents.

item.title: Final Fantasy VI
item.description: A widely regarded as one of the crowning achievements of the 16-bit era and a landmark in the history of RPGs.

item.title: INSIDE
item.description: A dark, atmospheric puzzle-platformer developed by same studio behind the acclaimed Limbo.

item.title: The Adventure Pals
item.description: A delightfully strange and heartwarming action-platformer that thrives on its sense of humor and creativity.

item.title: Bomberman 64
item.description: A bold and innovative reimagining of the series, venturing this classic franchise into fully 3D environments.

item.title: Bomberman Hero
item.description: A step away from the franchise’s multiplayer formula, venturing into full 3D single-player platforming territory.

item.title: NieR Automata
item.description: This title is one of those rare games that manages to be both a thrilling action experience and a profound work of art.

item.title: Super Bomberman 2
item.description: This title is a standout sequel that refined nearly every aspect of the original release.

item.title: Super Bomberman 4
item.description: This title is a vibrant and finely tuned installment in Hudson Soft’s long-running party-action franchise.

item.title: Chrono Cross
item.description: This title is a remarkable and ambitious follow-up to the legendary Chrono Trigger.

item.title: Crash Bandicoot 2 N-Tranced
item.description: An impressive continuation of The Huge Adventure and one of the strongest 2D interpretations of the franchise.

item.title: Heretic
item.description: A dark fantasy FPS that builds upon the foundation laid by Doom while carving out its own identity.

item.title: Journey
item.description: A deeply moving experience, renowned for crafting games that evoke emotion over traditional gameplay mechanics.

item.title: Shadow of Rome
item.description: An ambitious action-adventure game that combines intense gladiatorial combat with stealth and puzzle-solving elements.

item.title: L.A. Noire
item.description: This title is a captivating detective adventure, set in a stunningly detailed recreation of 1947 Los Angeles.

item.title: Metroid Fusion
item.description: A fast-paced, atmospheric reinvention of the Metroid formula that merges action, exploration, and narrative tension.

item.title: Outlast
item.description: This title is a first-person survival horror game that quickly became a modern benchmark for the genre.

item.title: Sniper Elite V2
item.description: A tactical shooter set in the World War II, where you take the role of an American sniper operating in war-torn Berlin.

item.title: The Legend of Zelda The Wind Waker
item.description: This title is a stunning remaster of one of the GameCube’s most unique Zelda titles.

item.title: Donkey Kong Country Returns
item.description: This title is a remarkable handheld adaptation of the Wii classic, skillfully reimagined for the Nintendo 3DS.

item.title: God of War Chains of Olympus
item.description: One of the most technically impressive and narratively engaging titles ever released for the PlayStation Portable.

item.title: ICO
item.description: This title is a landmark in video game design, celebrated for its minimalist yet profoundly emotional approach.

item.title: Okami HD
item.description: This title is a stunning remaster of one of the most artistically distinctive games ever made.

item.title: Onimusha Dawn of Dreams
item.description: A major shift for the series, evolving from its fixed-camera survival-action roots into an action-RPG experience.

item.title: Alundra 2
item.description: This sequel steps away from it’s psychological storytelling roots to a lighter, more comedic tone.

item.title: Gravity Circuit
item.description: This title is a 2D action platformer that pays homage to classic Mega Man titles while adding its own twists.

item.title: Lara Croft and the Temple of Osiris
item.description: This title is a top-down action-adventure game that shines in its cooperative multiplayer.

item.title: Noitu Love 2 Devolution
item.description: A 2D action game set in a futuristic world where you battle robotic invaders in a series of colorful, chaotic levels.

item.title: Rayman
item.description: The first Rayman entry is a landmark 2D platformer that introduced players to Ubisoft’s now-iconic limbless hero.

item.title: Splinter Cell Blacklist
item.description: A polished and versatile stealth-action game that refines the series’ formula with a focus on player choice.

item.title: Half-Life Blue Shift
item.description: This title is the second official expansion for Half-Life, developed by Gearbox Software and published by Sierra.

item.title: Illusion of Gaia
item.description: One of the most distinctive action RPGs of its time, blending historical settings and emotional storytelling.

item.title: Legend of Grimrock 2
item.description: A revival of classic dungeon crawlers like Dungeon Master, blending old-school mechanics with modern design.

item.title: Metal Gear Solid
item.description: This title is a landmark in the stealth-action genre, widely regarded as one of the most influential games of its era.

item.title: Sea of Stars
item.description: This title is a beautifully crafted homage to classic 16-bit JRPGs like Chrono Trigger and Golden Sun.

item.title: Half-Life Opposing Force
item.description: An expansion to Valve’s Half-Life that serves as an example of how to build upon an established classic.

item.title: Hotline Miami 2 Wrong Number
item.description: The second entry to Hotline Miami is a louder, harsher, and more ambitious follow-up to the original cult classic.

item.title: Metal Slug 4
item.description: A solid entry in SNK’s long-running run-and-gun series, originally an arcade title later ported to the PlayStation 2.

item.title: Metal Slug 6
item.description: A solid entry in SNK’s long-running run-and-gun series, originally an arcade title later ported to the PlayStation 2.

item.title: Metal Slug X
item.description: This title is an enhanced version of Metal Slug 2 that captures the spirit of the arcade original.

item.title: Metal Slug XX
item.description: This title is an enhanced port of Metal Slug 7 originally made for the Nintendo DS.

item.title: Final Fantasy IX
item.description: A beautifully crafted love letter to the series’ origins, charming characters, and profound storytelling.

item.title: Metal Slug 3
item.description: This Metal Slug entry stands as one of the most iconic and ambitious run-and-gun shooters ever made.

item.title: Metal Slug 5
item.description: This entry maintains the series’ trademark blend of chaotic action, expressive 2D animation, and tongue-in-cheek humor.

item.title: Metal Slug Super Vehicle 001
item.description: The very first Metal Slug entry is a fast-paced run-and-gun game that captures the charm of the original arcade version.

item.title: Castlevania Lords of Shadow
item.description: A cinematic reboot of the long-running series that reimagines it as a dark fantasy action-adventure.

item.title: FEAR Extraction Point
item.description: A strong expansion that successfully captures the tense, oppressive atmosphere that made the original game stand out.

item.title: FEAR Perseus Mandate
item.description: A standalone expansion that continues the series’ blend of tactical gunfights and supernatural tension.

item.title: Spelunky
item.description: This title is a brilliant blend of roguelike randomness and classic platforming precision.

item.title: Teslagrad
item.description: This title is a 2D puzzle-platformer that revolves around the manipulation of magnetism.

item.title: Resident Evil 4 Remake
item.description: This RE entry successfully modernizes the classic survival horror experience while keeping the essence of the original intact.

item.title: Super Princess Peach
item.description: This title offers a charming reversal of the classic Mario formula by casting Princess Peach as the hero for once.

item.title: System Shock Remake
item.description: A faithful reimagining of the 1994 classic, carefully modernized while preserving its eerie atmosphere and complex design.
